Authors:
Ruvishika Shehali Jayawardena, Mei Liu, Maharachchikumbura
Sandeshya Maharachchikumbura, Wei ZHANG, QiKai Xing, Kevin D Hyde,
Somrudee Nilthong, XingHong Li, Jiye Yan
Title:
Vitis vinifera leaf spot disease caused by Neopestalotiopsis
vitis sp. nov. from China
Abstract:
Neopestalotiopsis species are associated with a post
harvest fruit rot and trunk disease of grapevines in China. A new
species, N. vitis was isolated from the grape leaf spot in Guangxi
Province, China. Initially, small circular, slightly sunken, necrotic
spots, developed on the leaf surface, mainly at the inter-vein regions.
The spots enlarged rapidly and become brittle with age. Phylogenetic
species recognition based on analysis of the combined ITS, TUB2 and tef1
sequence data coupled with morphology distinguished N. vitis from all
other species in the genus. This is the first report of
Neopestalotiopsis species causing leaf spot of grapevine in China.
